results.definition: a covering that serves to conceal or shelter something
examples: a screen of trees afforded privacy
under cover of darkness
the brush provided a covert for game
the simplest concealment is to match perfectly the color of the background

results.definition: bedding that keeps a person warm in bed
examples: he pulled the covers over his head and went to sleep

results.definition: the act of concealing the existence of something by obstructing the view of it
examples: the cover concealed their guns from enemy aircraft

results.definition: the protective covering on the front, back, and spine of a book
examples: the book had a leather binding

results.definition: a natural object that covers or envelops
examples: under a covering of dust
the fox was flushed from its cover

results.definition: covering for a hole (especially a hole in the top of a container)
examples: he removed the top of the carton
he couldn't get the top off of the bottle
put the cover back on the kettle

results.definition: fire that makes it difficult for the enemy to fire on your own individuals or formations
examples: artillery provided covering fire for the withdrawal

results.definition: a fixed charge by a restaurant or nightclub over and above the charge for food and drink
a recording of a song that was first recorded or made popular by somebody else
examples: they made a cover of a Beatles' song

results.definition: a false identity and background (especially one created for an undercover agent)
examples: her new name and passport are cover for her next assignment

results.definition: provide with a covering or cause to be covered
examples: cover her face with a handkerchief
cover the child with a blanket
cover the grave with flowers

results.definition: form a cover over
examples: The grass covered the grave

results.definition: span an interval of distance, space or time
examples: The war extended over five years
The period covered the turn of the century
My land extends over the hills on the horizon
This farm covers some 200 acres
The Archipelago continues for another 500 miles

results.definition: provide for
examples: The grant doesn't cover my salary

results.definition: act on verbally or in some form of artistic expression
examples: This book deals with incest
The course covered all of Western Civilization
The new book treats the history of China

results.definition: include in scope; include as part of something broader; have as one's sphere or territory
examples: This group encompasses a wide range of people from different backgrounds
this should cover everyone in the group

results.definition: travel across or pass over
examples: The caravan covered almost 100 miles each day

results.definition: be responsible for reporting the details of, as in journalism
examples: Snow reported on China in the 1950's
The cub reporter covered New York City

results.definition: hold within range of an aimed firearm
to take an action to protect against future problems
examples: Count the cash in the drawer twice just to cover yourself

results.definition: hide from view or knowledge
examples: The President covered the fact that he bugged the offices in the White House

results.definition: protect or defend (a position in a game)
examples: he covered left field

results.definition: maintain a check on; especially by patrolling
examples: The second officer covered the top floor

results.definition: protect by insurance
examples: The insurance won't cover this

results.definition: make up for shortcomings or a feeling of inferiority by exaggerating good qualities
examples: he is compensating for being a bad father

results.definition: invest with a large or excessive amount of something
examples: She covered herself with glory

results.definition: help out by taking someone's place and temporarily assuming his responsibilities
examples: She is covering for our secretary who is ill this week

results.definition: be sufficient to meet, defray, or offset the charge or cost of
examples: Is this enough to cover the check?

results.definition: spread over a surface to conceal or protect
examples: This paint covers well

results.definition: cover as if with a shroud
examples: The origins of this civilization are shrouded in mystery

results.definition: copulate with a female, used especially of horses
examples: The horse covers the mare

results.definition: put something on top of something else
examples: cover the meat with a lot of gravy

results.definition: play a higher card than the one previously played
examples: Smith covered again

results.definition: be responsible for guarding an opponent in a game
sit on (eggs)
examples: Birds brood
The female covers the eggs

results.definition: clothe, as if for protection from the elements
examples: cover your head!
